pyastroprofile package¶

Submodules¶

pyastroprofile.AstroProfile module¶

class pyastroprofile.AstroProfile.AstroProfile[source]¶

Bases: object

This class acts as a container to hold other profiles.

Parameters

  • reldir – Path relative to the system configuration directory to store the yaml settings file.

  • name – The name of the settings file WITHOUT the ‘.yaml’ extension.

Currently the profiles stored are:

  • equipment (EquipmentProfile)

  • observatory (ObservatoryProfile)

  • settings (SettingsProfile)

Access is done as follows:

from pyastroprofile.AstroProfile import AstroProfile
ap = AstroProfile()
ap.read('myastroprofile')
print('latitude is ', ap.observatory.location.latitude)
print('camera driver is ', ap.equipment.camera.driver)
print('pixelscale is ', ap.settings.platesolve.pixelscale)
ap.observatory.location.altitude = 300.0
ap.equipment.focuser.driver = 'Focuser Simulator'
ap.write()

The astroprofile is stored in the file in the directory get_astroprofile_base_dir() and contains the names of the individual profile files for the different profiles contained by the AstroProfile.

create_reference(ref_name, equipment_profile, observatory_profile, settings_profile, overwrite=False)[source]¶

Creates an astroprofile reference file which declares the other profiles to be contained within this astroprofile.

Parameters

  • ref_name (str) – Name of the reference file.

  • equipment_profile (str) – Name of the equipment profile.

  • observatory_profile (str) – Name of the observatory profile.

  • settings_profile (str) – Name of the settings profile.

  • overwrite (bool) – Whether to overwrite existing file or not.

equipment = None¶

Use to access the equipment profile.

observatory = None¶

Use to access the observatory profile.

read(name)[source]¶

Read an AstroProfile.

Parameters

name (str) – Name of astroprofile file to be loaded.

settings = None¶

Use to access the settings profile.

pyastroprofile.AstroProfile.get_astroprofile_base_dir()[source]¶

Returns the base directory for astroprofile files.

pyastroprofile.EquipmentProfile module¶

class pyastroprofile.EquipmentProfile.EquipmentProfile(reldir, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: pyastroprofile.ProfileDict.Profile

This class represents the equipment profile.

Parameters

  • reldir – Path relative to the system configuration directory to store the yaml settings file.

  • name – The name of the settings file WITHOUT the ‘.yaml’ extension.

Currently the settings stored are:

  • focuser

  • filterwheel

  • camera

  • mount

  • telescope

Access is done as follows:

from pyastroprofile.EquipmentProfile import EquipmentProfile
ep = EquipmentProfile(reldir='equipment', name='myequipment')
ep.read()
print('camera driver is ', ep.camera.driver)
ep.telscope.focal_length = 1000.0
ep.write()

This example will create the file ‘<system config dir>/equipment/myequipment.yaml’

NOTE: It is recommended to use the AstroProfile class for accessing these settings as it includes the ObservatoryProfile class.

pyastroprofile.ObservatoryProfile module¶

class pyastroprofile.ObservatoryProfile.ObservatoryProfile(reldir, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: pyastroprofile.ProfileDict.Profile

This class represents the observing location including geographical and time relating settings.

Parameters

  • reldir – Path relative to the system configuration directory to store the yaml settings file.

  • name – The name of the settings file WITHOUT the ‘.yaml’ extension.

Currently the parameter stored is:

  • location

Access is done as follows:

from pyastroprofile.ObservatoryProfile import ObservatoryProfile
op = ObservatoryProfile(reldir='observatories', name='myobservatory')
op.read()
print('latitude is ', op.location.latitude)
op.location.altitude = 300.0
sp.write()

This example will create the file ‘<system config dir>/observatories/myobservatory.yaml’

NOTE: It is recommended to use the AstroProfile class for accessing these settings as it includes the ObservatoryProfile class.

pyastroprofile.SettingsProfile module¶

class pyastroprofile.SettingsProfile.SettingsProfile(reldir, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: pyastroprofile.ProfileDict.Profile

This class represents the program settings for the various programs involved in the imaging tool chain. Anything settings specific to a particular hardware profile will be stored here. Settings which are not specific to a hardware profile but are instead global to all profile (like the path to an executable) will be stored in a settings file specific to the particular program.

Parameters

  • reldir – Path relative to the system configuration directory to store the yaml settings file.

  • name – The name of the settings file WITHOUT the ‘.yaml’ extension.

Currently the settings stored are:

  • platesolve

  • autofocus

Access is done as follows:

from pyastroprofile.SettingsProfile import SettingsProfile
sp = SettingsProfile(reldir='settings', name='mysettings')
sp.read()
print('pixelscale is ', sp.platesolve.pixelscale)
print('focus direction is ', sp.autofocus.focus_dir)
sp.platesolve.pixelscale = 3.0
sp.write()

This example will create the file ‘<system config dir>/settings/mysettings.yaml’

NOTE: It is recommended to use the AstroProfile class for accessing these settings as it includes the SettingsProfile class.

class AutoFocusSettings(start_hfr: float = 25.0, near_hfr: float = 12.0, focus_delay: float = 0.0, focus_dir: str = 'IN', exposure_start: float = 1.0, exposure_max: float = 8.0, exposure_min: float = 0.5, _sectionname: str = 'autofocus')[source]¶
